class_notes: The primary objective of this course is to introduce students to the major theoretical perspectives, research findings, and controversies in the study of public policy. We will examine the processes through which individuals, organizations, and institutions interact to shape how the government responds to social problems. We will focus on how variation in the how issues are defined, how institutions are structured, and how decisions are made affect the capacity of governments to act (or not to act) to solve important public problems. We will apply course concepts to current public policies issues to help students understand how they work in practice.
course_description: How national public policies develop. Focus on who American governing actors and elites are, what they control, how they work together, and how issues thereby develop, recur, and evolve into policy.
